channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: We have a winner in the world’s first quantum chess tournament
item.description: It’s like playing in a multiverse “but the different boards are connected to each other”

item.title: Phosphorus equivalent of graphene makes reconfigurable transistors
item.description: May be useful for security, as it’s hard to tell how the circuitry might execute.

item.title: VR meetings are weird, but they beat our current reality
item.description: VR app called Arthur lets you, distant colleagues collaborate within a 3D meeting space.

item.title: Zodiac Killer cipher is cracked after eluding sleuths for 51 years
item.description: Northern California serial murderer sent encoded messages that went uncracked until now.

item.title: Oracle joins Silicon Valley’s Texas exodus
item.description: Elon Musk revealed he had moved to Texas earlier this week.

item.title: Copyright law is bricking your game console. Time to fix that
item.description: Op-ed: An exemption to the DMCA could make DIY console repairs possible—and legal.

item.title: The Christchurch shooter and YouTube’s radicalization trap
item.description: Researchers say YouTube’s policies and algorithms are still too opaque.

item.title: FDA has authorized the first COVID-19 vaccine [Updated]
item.description: FDA head had been told to submit his resignation if vaccine wasn’t approved Friday.

item.title: Apple is full-steam ahead on replacing Qualcomm modems with its own
item.description: SVP Johny Srouji told Apple employees that development kicked off this year.

item.title: Apple’s app store is an illegal monopoly, rival Cydia claims in suit
item.description: Apple argues the iPhone and its app store are part of the same product.

item.title: Where do I go now that CentOS Linux is gone? Check our list
item.description: CentOS was the most famous “RHEL rebuild” by far—but there are others.

item.title: Facebook says hackers backed by Vietnam’s government are linked to IT firm
item.description: Group is known for its robust, custom-made malware. IT firm says the link is a mistake.

item.title: Boston Dynamics sells to Hyundai Motor Group in $1.1 billion deal
item.description: Boston Dynamics gets access to Hyundai’s serious manufacturing supply chain.

item.title: The Expanse S5 review: The show is bigger, bolder, and better than ever
item.description: The board is set, the pieces moving, and the show’s fifth season is devastatingly good.

item.title: “Mass Effect Will Return:” Teaser trailer sets a new (old) direction for the sequel
item.description: Players are not going all the way out to Andromeda this time.

item.title: We’ve got our first real look at Loki as Disney drops lengthy teaser trailer
item.description: It was just one of a smorgasbord of offerings presented at Disney’s Investor Day.

item.title: Wormable code-execution flaw in Cisco Jabber has a severity rating of 9.9 out of 10
item.description: The company failed to adequately fix the vulnerability before, so it’s trying again.

item.title: Working from home at 25MHz: You could do worse than a Quadra 700 (even in 2020)
item.description: Famously, Apple’s Quadra 700 once helped track dinosaurs. Is it stuck in amber nowadays?

item.title: Rocket Report: SN8 meets its fate, SLS Green Run tests to resume next week
item.description: “We’re not going to have big issues that cause us to stand down.”

item.title: More Disney 2021 plans: Kate McKinnon as Elizabeth Holmes, Y: The Last Man on FX
item.description: Wait… they got Mahershala Ali to revive Blade, too?

item.title: Visa and MasterCard ban Pornhub over abusive videos
item.description: New York Times columnist Nick Kristof inspired increased scrutiny of Pornhub.
